analyzed: de lta bas na mar me skye bzhin pa mun pa dang phrad pa med pas mun pa sel bar mi byed do //
translated: Thus, since the arising of the flame does not make contact with darkness, it does not dispel darkness.

original: yang gzhan yang /ğŸ”½mar me rang dang gzhan gyi dngos //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang / mar me rang dang gzhan gyi dngos //
translated: Moreover:

original: gal te snang bar byed 'gyur na //ğŸ”½mun pa'ang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos //
analyzed: gal te snang bar byed 'gyur na // mun pa'ang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos //
translated: If the flame illuminates itself and others,ğŸ”½then without a doubt darkness

original: sgrib par 'gyur bar the tshom med //
analyzed: sgrib par 'gyur bar the tshom med //
translated: would also obscure itself and others.

original: gal te mar me rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag / snang bar byed pa yin par sems na /
analyzed: gal te mar me rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag / snang bar byed pa yin par sems na /
translated: If you think that the flame illuminates itself and others,

original: de ltar na mar me'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa mun pa yang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag sgrib par 'gyur bar the tshom med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mar me'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa mun pa yang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag sgrib par 'gyur bar the tshom med do //
translated: then without a doubt darkness would also obscure itself and others, since darkness is the opposite of a flame.

original: mun pas rang gi dngos po bsgribs na ni ;
analyzed: mun pas rang gi dngos po bsgribs na ni ;
translated: If darkness obscures itself,

original: mun pa mi dmigs shing dngos po rnams rtag tu snang bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: mun pa mi dmigs shing dngos po rnams rtag tu snang bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: then darkness would not be observed and things would always be illuminated, but that is unacceptable.

original: ci ste mar me'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa mun pa rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po sgrib par mi byed na ni /ğŸ”½'o na grogs po mar me rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po gnyi ga snang bar byed do //
analyzed: ci ste mar me'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa mun pa rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po sgrib par mi byed na ni / 'o na grogs po mar me rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po gnyi ga snang bar byed do //
translated: But if darkness, which is the antithesis of a lamp, does not obstruct itself and others,

original: zhes gang smras pa de mi rung ste /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de mi rung ste /
translated: then it is not correct to say, â€œA lamp illuminates both itself and others.â€

original: de ltar re zhig dpe bsal to //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig dpe bsal to //
translated: Thus the example is refuted in this way.

original: de ni don 'di la khyod kyi mar me'i dpe mtshon pa'i skye bas rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de ni don 'di la khyod kyi mar me'i dpe mtshon pa'i skye bas rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag skyed par byed do //
translated: In this regard, you may say, â€œThe example of a lamp illustrates arising, which causes the generation of both itself and others.â€

original: zhes bya ba de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: But this should be explained as follows:

original: skye ba 'di ni ma skyes pas //
analyzed: skye ba 'di ni ma skyes pas //
translated: This arising, not having arisen,

original: rang gi bdag nyid ji ltar skyed //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid ji ltar skyed //
translated: How could it generate itself?

original: ci ste skyes pas skyed byed na ;
analyzed: ci ste skyes pas skyed byed na ;
translated: But if you think that that which has arisen causes generation,

original: / skyes na ci zhig bskyed du yod //
analyzed: / skyes na ci zhig bskyed du yod //
translated: What arisen thing is there that is generated?

original: skye ba gang yin pa 'dis rang gi bdag nyid skyed par byed na /
analyzed: skye ba gang yin pa 'dis rang gi bdag nyid skyed par byed na /
translated: If this arising causes the generation of itself,

original: skyes pa'am ma skyes pa zhig skyed par byed grang na /
analyzed: skyes pa'am ma skyes pa zhig skyed par byed grang na /
translated: is it that which has arisen or that which has not arisen that causes generation?

original: re zhig gal te ma skyes pas ni rang gi bdag nyid skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: re zhig gal te ma skyes pas ni rang gi bdag nyid skyed par mi byed de /
translated: First, if that which has not arisen causes the generation of itself,

original: ma skyes pa ni med pa nyid yin pas med pa des rang gi bdag nyid ji ltar @46a * //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni med pa nyid yin pas med pa des rang gi bdag nyid ji ltar @46a * //
translated: then that which has not arisen is nonexistent. How could that which is nonexistent

original: skyed par byed /ğŸ”½ci ste skyes pas skyed par byed par sems na de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: skyed par byed / ci ste skyes pas skyed par byed par sems na de yang mi rung ste /
translated: cause the generation of itself?ğŸ”½But if you think that that which has arisen causes the generation of itself,

original: gang gi tshe de skyes na skyes zin pa yin pas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de skyes na skyes zin pa yin pas /
translated: that also is not tenable. When it has arisen, it has already arisen.

original: skyes zin pa de la yang ci zhig bskyed du yod de /
analyzed: skyes zin pa de la yang ci zhig bskyed du yod de /
translated: What is there to be generated with respect to that which has already arisen?ğŸ”½That which has already arisen does not need to be generated, and that which

original: skyes zin pa la ni bskyed par bya ba med cing byas zin pa la yang bya ba med do //
analyzed: skyes zin pa la ni bskyed par bya ba med cing byas zin pa la yang bya ba med do //
translated: has already been done does not need to be done again.

original: de ltar skye ba 'di skyes pas rang gi bdag nyid skyed dam /
analyzed: de ltar skye ba 'di skyes pas rang gi bdag nyid skyed dam /
translated: In this way, if arising causes the generation of itself, does it cause the

original: ma skyes pas skyed par byed grang na /
analyzed: ma skyes pas skyed par byed grang na /
translated: generation of itself as arisen or unarisen?ğŸ”½But it does not cause the generation of itself in either case. Therefore, sinceğŸ”½arising does not cause the generation of itself, it makes no sense to say that

original: gnyi ga ltar yang skyed par mi byed pa de'i phyir skye bas rang gi bdag nyid skyed par mi byed pas de la skyes pas rang gi dngos po skyed par byed do zhes gang smras pa de mi rigs so //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang skyed par mi byed pa de'i phyir skye bas rang gi bdag nyid skyed par mi byed pas de la skyes pas rang gi dngos po skyed par byed do zhes gang smras pa de mi rigs so //
translated: that which has arisen causes the generation of itself.

original: gnas pa (dang) 'jig pa dag la yang de bzhin du brtag go //
analyzed: gnas pa (dang) 'jig pa dag la yang de bzhin du brtag go //
translated: So too, endurance and destruction should be investigated in the same way.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: skyes dang ma skyes skye bzhin pa //
analyzed: skyes dang ma skyes skye bzhin pa //
translated: That which has arisen, that which has not arisen, and that now arising

original: ji lta bur yang skye mi byed //
analyzed: ji lta bur yang skye mi byed //
translated: Do not arise in any way whatsoever.

original: song dang ma song bgom pa yis //
analyzed: song dang ma song bgom pa yis //
translated: Through that which has gone, that which has not gone, and that being gone,

original: de dag rnam par bshad pa yin //
analyzed: de dag rnam par bshad pa yin //
translated: They are completely explained.

original: skye bas gzhan skyed par byed na /
analyzed: skye bas gzhan skyed par byed na /
translated: If arising causes the generation of another,

original: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang skyes bzhin pa zhig skyed par byed grang na /
analyzed: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang skyes bzhin pa zhig skyed par byed grang na /
translated: does it cause the generation of that which has arisen, that which has not arisen, or that now arising?

original: brtag pa rnam pa gsum char yang skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: brtag pa rnam pa gsum char yang skyed par mi byed de /
translated: The three types of analysis do not cause generation.

original: ji ltar skyed par mi byed pa de ltar ni song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa dag gis de dag rnam par bshad zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar skyed par mi byed pa de ltar ni song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa dag gis de dag rnam par bshad zin to //
translated: How they do not cause generation has already been explained through that which has gone, that which has not gone, and that being gone.

original: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bshad pa / re zhig dngos po skyes pa ni skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: bshad pa / re zhig dngos po skyes pa ni skyed par mi byed de /
translated: First, an arisen thing does not cause generation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / byas pa la bya ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / byas pa la bya ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it would absurdly follow that there would be an infinite regress and because that which has been produced has no activity.

original: dngos po gang skyes pa yang skyed par byed na /
analyzed: dngos po gang skyes pa yang skyed par byed na /
translated: If it generates that which has already arisen,ğŸ”½then that which has arisen twice would have to generate that which has arisen thrice, and that which has arisen thrice would have to generate that which has arisen four times, and so on.

original: lan gnyis skyes pa yang lan gsum bskyed dgos la lan gsum skyed pa yang lan bzhir bskyed dgos pa dang // de bzhin du dang po skyes pa dang 'og tu skyes pa dag kyang de bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: lan gnyis skyes pa yang lan gsum bskyed dgos la lan gsum skyed pa yang lan bzhir bskyed dgos pa dang // de bzhin du dang po skyes pa dang 'og tu skyes pa dag kyang de bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: And in the same way, that which has arisen first and that which has arisen later would be like that.

original: de lta na skye ba mthar thug pa med par 'gyur pas de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de lta na skye ba mthar thug pa med par 'gyur pas de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: But that is unacceptable, since in that case there would be no final limit to arising.

original: de'i phyir dngos po skyes pas skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po skyes pas skyed par mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, that which has arisen does not generate that which has arisen.

original: gal te yang skyes pas skyed par byed na /ğŸ”½skye ba gang gis bskyed par bya bar brjod pa'i skye ba gzhan de ma skyes pa skyed pa yin pas /
analyzed: gal te yang skyes pas skyed par byed na / skye ba gang gis bskyed par bya bar brjod pa'i skye ba gzhan de ma skyes pa skyed pa yin pas /
translated: Moreover, if that which has arisen generates that which has arisen,ğŸ”½then that which has arisen would generate that which has arisen by means of another arising.

original: de ma skyes pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de ma skyes pa skyed par byed do //
translated: But that which has arisen does not generate that which has arisen.

original: zhes dam bcas pa nyams te /
analyzed: zhes dam bcas pa nyams te /
translated: This contradicts your thesis.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dang po skye ba'i snga rol na ma skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: de dang po skye ba'i snga rol na ma skyes pa yin la /
translated: That which has arisen does not exist prior to the arising of that which has arisen.

original: de nas skyed par yang byed na /
analyzed: de nas skyed par yang byed na /
translated: If it generates that which has arisen,ğŸ”½then that which has arisen would generate that which has arisen.

original: de'i phyir 'ga' zhig skyes pa skyed par byed la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'ga' zhig skyes pa skyed par byed la /
translated: Therefore, some say: That which is already arisen generates that which is already arisen.

original: 'ga' zhig ni ma skyes pa skyed par byed pas mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni ma skyes pa skyed par byed pas mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, some say, â€œIt is contradictory that some that have arisen cause generation and some that have not arisen cause generation.

original: de ltar 'dod na ma nges pa @46b nyid kyang yin la /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod na ma nges pa @46b nyid kyang yin la /
translated: If you assert that, it would be indeterminate.

original: byas pa la bya ba med pa dang / bsregs pa la bsreg par bya ba med pa dang / song ba la bgrod par bya ba med pa dang / mngon sum du byas pa la mngon sum du bya ba med pa dang / skyes pa la skyed par byed pa med pas /
analyzed: byas pa la bya ba med pa dang / bsregs pa la bsreg par bya ba med pa dang / song ba la bgrod par bya ba med pa dang / mngon sum du byas pa la mngon sum du bya ba med pa dang / skyes pa la skyed par byed pa med pas /
translated: Since there is no activity in that which is produced, no burning in that which is burned, no going in that which has gone, no object of perception in that which is perceived, and no generation in that which has arisen,

original: de'i phyir re zhig de ltar chos skyes pa 'ga' yang skyed par mi byed do ;
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig de ltar chos skyes pa 'ga' yang skyed par mi byed do ;
translated: then, first, it is not that some arisen phenomena cause generation.

original: / chos ma skyes pa yang skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: / chos ma skyes pa yang skyed par mi byed de /
translated: Also, it is not that nonarisen phenomena cause generation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skye ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dang / ma skyes pa thams cad kyang skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: skye ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dang / ma skyes pa thams cad kyang skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are not endowed with arising and because it follows that all nonarisen phenomena would arise.

original: 'di na ma skyes pa ni skye ba dang mi ldan la /
analyzed: 'di na ma skyes pa ni skye ba dang mi ldan la /
translated: Here, that which has not arisen is not endowed with arising.

original: de yang dngos po skye ba dang ldan pas skyed par byed dam /
analyzed: de yang dngos po skye ba dang ldan pas skyed par byed dam /
translated: Moreover, does that which generates give rise to an existent thing?

original: 'on te dngos po skye ba dang mi ldan pas skyed par byed grang na /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po skye ba dang mi ldan pas skyed par byed grang na /
translated: Or does that which generates give rise to a nonexistent thing?

original: de lta na bya ba med par yang byed pa dang / 'gro ba med par yang 'gro ba dang / za ba med par yang za ba dang / 'dod chags med par yang chags pa dang / zhe sdang med par yang sdang ba dang / gti mug med par yang rmongs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na bya ba med par yang byed pa dang / 'gro ba med par yang 'gro ba dang / za ba med par yang za ba dang / 'dod chags med par yang chags pa dang / zhe sdang med par yang sdang ba dang / gti mug med par yang rmongs par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then an agent would perform an action even without activity, one would go even without going, one would eat even without eating, one would be attached even without attachment, one would hate even without hatred, and one would be confused even without confusion.

original: tha snyad rnams dang 'gal bas de yang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: tha snyad rnams dang 'gal bas de yang mi 'dod de /
translated: But since that contradicts conventions, that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir dngos po ma skyes pa yang skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po ma skyes pa yang skyed par mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, that which generates does not generate an unarisen thing.

original: gal te yang dngos po ma skyes pa skyed par byed na /
analyzed: gal te yang dngos po ma skyes pa skyed par byed na /
translated: Moreover, if that which generates generates an unarisen thing,

original: don gang dag ma skyes pa de dag thams cad kyang skye bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: don gang dag ma skyes pa de dag thams cad kyang skye bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that all things that are unarisen would arise.

original: de la byis pa so so'i skye po thams cad la byang chub ma skyes pa de yang skye bar thal ba dang / dgra bcom pa mi g-yo ba'i chos can rnams la kun nas nyon mongs pa ma skyes pa de yang skye bar thal ba dang /
analyzed: de la byis pa so so'i skye po thams cad la byang chub ma skyes pa de yang skye bar thal ba dang / dgra bcom pa mi g-yo ba'i chos can rnams la kun nas nyon mongs pa ma skyes pa de yang skye bar thal ba dang /
translated: In response to that, it would follow that the enlightenment that has not arisen in all ordinary beings would arise, the affliction that has not arisen in arhats who are immutable would arise,

original: ri bong dang rta'i rva la sogs pa ma skyes pa de yang skye bar thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: ri bong dang rta'i rva la sogs pa ma skyes pa de yang skye bar thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de /
translated: and the horns of a rabbit and a horse and so on that have not arisen would arise. But that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir ma skyes pa yang skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma skyes pa yang skyed par mi byed de /
translated: Therefore that which has not arisen does not cause generation.

original: nyon mongs pa bsregs pa'i nyon mongs pa bskyed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bsregs pa'i nyon mongs pa bskyed pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the generation of the affliction of one whose affliction has been burned.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, some say:

original: ma skyes pa ni skyed par byed de de yang gang rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa dang / yul dang dus dang / byed pa po dang thabs dang ldan par skyed par byed kyi ma skyes pa thams cad ni skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni skyed par byed de de yang gang rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa dang / yul dang dus dang / byed pa po dang thabs dang ldan par skyed par byed kyi ma skyes pa thams cad ni skyed par mi byed de /
translated: That which has not arisen causes generation. That which has not arisen is generated when the assembly of causes and conditions, the object, time, agent, and method are complete. But not all that has not arisen causes generation.

original: gang rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa dang yul dang dus dang byed pa po dang thabs dang bral ba skyed par mi byed pas /
analyzed: gang rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa dang yul dang dus dang byed pa po dang thabs dang bral ba skyed par mi byed pas /
translated: But that which is devoid of a cause and conditions, a place, time, an agent, and a method does not generate anything.

original: de'i phyir ma skyes pa thams cad skye bar thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma skyes pa thams cad skye bar thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it follows that all that is not arisen would arise.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gang rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa dang / yul dang dus dang / byed pa po dang thabs dang ldan pa skyed par byed do zhes bya ba de yang yod par gyur pa yang skyed par @47a * //
analyzed: gang rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa dang / yul dang dus dang / byed pa po dang thabs dang ldan pa skyed par byed do zhes bya ba de yang yod par gyur pa yang skyed par @47a * //
translated: That which is endowed with a cause and conditions, a place, time, an agent, and a method generates.

original: mi byed / med par gyur pa yang skyed par mi byed /
analyzed: mi byed / med par gyur pa yang skyed par mi byed /
translated: But that which exists does not generate itself. That which does not exist does not generate itself.

original: yod med du gyur pa yang skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: yod med du gyur pa yang skyed par mi byed de /
translated: That which both exists and does not exist does not generate itself.

original: rnam pa de gsum char gyis skyed pa mi 'thad par sngar rnam par bshad zin pas /
analyzed: rnam pa de gsum char gyis skyed pa mi 'thad par sngar rnam par bshad zin pas /
translated: Since it has already been explained that generation is untenable in these three ways,

original: de'i phyir ma skyes pa yang skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma skyes pa yang skyed par mi byed do //
translated: therefore that which is not arisen does not generate itself.

original: de bzhin du dngos po skye bzhin pa yang skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po skye bzhin pa yang skyed par mi byed de /
translated: In the same way, an entity that is in the process of arising does not generate itself.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skyes pa skyed par byed pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / ma skyes pa skyed par byed pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: skyes pa skyed par byed pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / ma skyes pa skyed par byed pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: because the error of generating that which has arisen would ensue, and because the error of generating that which has not arisen would ensue.

original: skye bzhin pa skyes pa gang yin pa yang gtan tshigs sngar smos pa dag gis skyed par mi byed la /
analyzed: skye bzhin pa skyes pa gang yin pa yang gtan tshigs sngar smos pa dag gis skyed par mi byed la /
translated: That which is in the process of arising and has arisen is not generated by the previously mentioned reasons.

original: skye bzhin pa ma skyes pa gang yin pa yang gtan tshigs sngar smos pa dag gis skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa ma skyes pa gang yin pa yang gtan tshigs sngar smos pa dag gis skyed par mi byed do //
translated: That which is in the process of arising and has not arisen is also not generated by the previously mentioned reasons.

original: gal te yang skye bzhin pa skye ba med cing /
analyzed: gal te yang skye bzhin pa skye ba med cing /
translated: Moreover, if that which is in the process of arising is not arising,

original: 'on kyang skye bzhin pa skyed par yang byed na ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang skye bzhin pa skyed par yang byed na ni /
translated: and yet it generates that which is in the process of arising,

original: skye ba med pa'i skye bzhin pa ma mthong bas de'i phyir skye bzhin pa skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i skye bzhin pa ma mthong bas de'i phyir skye bzhin pa skyed par mi byed do //
translated: then since one does not see that which is in the process of arising that is not arising, therefore it does not generate that which is in the process of arising.

original: gang la skye bzhin pa skyed par byed pa de la skye ba gnyis su thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang la skye bzhin pa skyed par byed pa de la skye ba gnyis su thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that which is in the process of arising generates that which is in the process of arising, then the error of two arisings would ensue.

original: skye bzhin pa gang gis skye bzhin pa nyid du 'gyur ba dang / skye bzhin pa skyed par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa gang gis skye bzhin pa nyid du 'gyur ba dang / skye bzhin pa skyed par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: that which is in the process of arising would arise by means of that which is in the process of arising, and that which is in the process of arising would cause the arising of that which is in the process of arising.

original: skye ba gnyis su mi rigs te /
analyzed: skye ba gnyis su mi rigs te /
translated: Two arisings are not tenable.

original: dngos po skyes pa gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po skyes pa gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because two things that have arisen do not exist.

original: de'i phyir skye bzhin pa yang skyed par mi byed do ;
analyzed: de'i phyir skye bzhin pa yang skyed par mi byed do ;
translated: Therefore, that which is in the process of arising does not cause the arising of that which is in the process of arising.

original: / skye ba rtsom pa'i snga rol na yang gang du skye ba rtsom par 'gyur ba'i skye bzhin pa med de /
analyzed: / skye ba rtsom pa'i snga rol na yang gang du skye ba rtsom par 'gyur ba'i skye bzhin pa med de /
translated: Moreover, prior to the commencement of arising, that which is in the process of arising does not exist, where the commencement of arising would occur.

original: skye ba rtsom pa med na skye bzhin pa yang med pa'i phyir skye bzhin pa skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: skye ba rtsom pa med na skye bzhin pa yang med pa'i phyir skye bzhin pa skyed par mi byed do //
translated: Because if the commencement of arising does not exist, that which is in the process of arising does not exist. Therefore, that which is in the process of arising does not cause the arising of that which is in the process of arising.

original: de ltar skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang skye bzhin bskyed par mi byed pa'i phyir skye ba rab tu mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de ltar skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang skye bzhin bskyed par mi byed pa'i phyir skye ba rab tu mi 'grub ste /
translated: Thus, because that which has arisen, that which has not arisen, and that which is in the process of arising do not cause the arising of that which is in the process of arising, arising is not established.

original: skye ba rab tu ma grub na /
analyzed: skye ba rab tu ma grub na /
translated: If arising is not established,

original: gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag kyang rab tu mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag kyang rab tu mi 'grub bo //
translated: enduring and ceasing are also not established.

original: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag rab tu ma grub na /
analyzed: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag rab tu ma grub na /
translated: If arising, enduring, and ceasing are not established,

original: 'dus byas kyang rab tu mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyang rab tu mi 'grub ste /
translated: Also, the produced is not established.

original: de ltar de dag ni song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa dag ni rnam par bshad par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa dag ni rnam par bshad par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that the explanation of where one has gone, where one has not gone, and where one goes is complete.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: skyed pa la brten nas skye bzhin ba zhes brjod de /
analyzed: skyed pa la brten nas skye bzhin ba zhes brjod de /
translated: In dependence on the produced, the produced is said to exist.

original: bsam pa 'di na skye bzhin pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: bsam pa 'di na skye bzhin pa skyed par byed do //
translated: In this regard, the produced is produced in dependence on the producer.

original: 'dir bshad pa /ğŸ”½gang tshe skye ba yod pas ni //ğŸ”½skye bzhin 'di 'byung med pa'i tshe //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gang tshe skye ba yod pas ni // skye bzhin 'di 'byung med pa'i tshe //
translated: Here, NÄgÄrjuna explains:ğŸ”½When the produced does not existğŸ”½In dependence on the producer,

original: ji ltar skye la brten nas ni //ğŸ”½skye bzhin zhes ni brjod par bya //ğŸ”½gang gi tshe skye ba yod pas /
analyzed: ji ltar skye la brten nas ni // skye bzhin zhes ni brjod par bya // gang gi tshe skye ba yod pas /
translated: How could the produced existğŸ”½In dependence on the producer?

original: skye bzhin pa 'di 'byung ngo zhes @47b bya ba med pa'i tshe /
analyzed: skye bzhin pa 'di 'byung ngo zhes @47b bya ba med pa'i tshe /
translated: When the produced does not exist in dependence on the producer,ğŸ”½how could the produced exist in dependence on the producer?

original: ji ltar skye ba la brten nas skye bzhin pa zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: ji ltar skye ba la brten nas skye bzhin pa zhes brjod par bya /
translated: How could the produced be said to exist in dependence on the producer?

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: rten cing 'byung ba gang yin pa //
analyzed: rten cing 'byung ba gang yin pa //
translated: Whatever is dependently arisen

original: de ni ngo bo nyid kyis zhi //
analyzed: de ni ngo bo nyid kyis zhi //
translated: Is peace by nature.

original: de phyir skye bzhin nyid dang ni //
analyzed: de phyir skye bzhin nyid dang ni //
translated: Therefore, the produced

original: skye ba yang ni zhi ba nyid //
analyzed: skye ba yang ni zhi ba nyid //
translated: And also arising is peace.

original: 'di ltar brten nas 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid kyis zhi ba de'i phyir skye bzhin pa nyid dang skye ba yang zhi ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar brten nas 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid kyis zhi ba de'i phyir skye bzhin pa nyid dang skye ba yang zhi ba nyid do //
translated: Thus, that which originates in dependence is peace by nature. Therefore, that which is in the process of arising and arising are peace.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: dus gsum rnam par bzhag pa las ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po ma 'ongs pa'i bdag nyid kyis yod pas de skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus gsum rnam par bzhag pa las ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po ma 'ongs pa'i bdag nyid kyis yod pas de skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since a future thing exists by means of its own future nature in the context of the presentation of the three times, it arises.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te dngos po ma skyes pa //
analyzed: gal te dngos po ma skyes pa //
translated: If a non-arisen thing

original: 'ga' zhig gang na yod gyur na //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gang na yod gyur na //
translated: Existed somewhere,

original: de ni ci phyir der skye 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni ci phyir der skye 'gyur //
translated: Why would it arise there?

original: yod na skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod na skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it exists, it would not arise.

original: gal te dngos po ma skyes pa 'ga' zhig ma 'ongs pa'i dus gang na yod par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po ma skyes pa 'ga' zhig ma 'ongs pa'i dus gang na yod par gyur na /
translated: If a non-arisen thing existed somewhere in the future,

original: de ci'i phyir da ltar gyi dus der skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir da ltar gyi dus der skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: why would it arise in the present?

original: de de na yod na yod pa'i phyir da 'dir skye bar mi 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½ci ste skye bar 'dod na /
analyzed: de de na yod na yod pa'i phyir da 'dir skye bar mi 'gyur ro // ci ste skye bar 'dod na /
translated: If it exists there, it would not arise here in the present because it exists there.ğŸ”½But if you assert that it arises,

original: de la bshad par bya ste ;
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste ;
translated: we respond:

original: dngos po de 'dir skye bar gyur na /
analyzed: dngos po de 'dir skye bar gyur na /
translated: If that thing were to arise here,

original: de lta na dngos po de ma 'ongs pa'i dus de na yod pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na dngos po de ma 'ongs pa'i dus de na yod pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: then that thing would not exist in the future.

original: de yang mi 'dod pas /
analyzed: de yang mi 'dod pas /
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po yod pa de skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po yod pa de skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de yang mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is also illogical to state, â€œThat which is the existent future thing arises.â€

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: khyod kyis sngar skye bas skye bzhin pa skyed par byed do zhes gang smras pa de la bshad par bya ste /ğŸ”½gal te skye ba de yis ni //
analyzed: khyod kyis sngar skye bas skye bzhin pa skyed par byed do zhes gang smras pa de la bshad par bya ste / gal te skye ba de yis ni //
translated: you previously stated, â€œThat which is arising generates that which is in the process of arising.â€ğŸ”½We will now explain that.ğŸ”½If that arising

original: skye bzhin pa ni skyed byed na //ğŸ”½skye ba de ni skyed byed pa //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa ni skyed byed na // skye ba de ni skyed byed pa //
translated: generates that which is in the process of arising,ğŸ”½then what is the arising

original: skye ba yang ni gang zhig yin //
analyzed: skye ba yang ni gang zhig yin //
translated: that generates that arising?

original: gal te skye ba de des skye bzhin pa skyed par byed na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba de des skye bzhin pa skyed par byed na /
translated: If that arising generates that which is in the process of arising,

original: 'o na da skye ba skyed par byed pa'i skye ba yang gang zhig yin /
analyzed: 'o na da skye ba skyed par byed pa'i skye ba yang gang zhig yin /
translated: then what is the arising that generates that arising?

original: de la 'di snyam du skye ba gzhan zhig gis skye ba des skyed par sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du skye ba gzhan zhig gis skye ba des skyed par sems na /
translated: But if you think that another arising generates that arising,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: then NÄgÄrjuna addresses this point:

original: gal te skye ba gzhan zhig gis //
analyzed: gal te skye ba gzhan zhig gis //
translated: If another arising causes the generation of that,

original: de skyed thug pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: de skyed thug pa med par 'gyur //
translated: there will be an infinite regress.

original: gal te skye ba gzhan zhig gis skye bzhin pa skyed par byed pa'i skye ba de skyed par byed na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba gzhan zhig gis skye bzhin pa skyed par byed pa'i skye ba de skyed par byed na /
translated: If another arising causes the generation of that arising that causes the generation of that which is arising,

original: de lta na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then there will be an infinite regress.

original: ci ste 'di snyam du skye bzhin pa skyed par byed pa'i skye ba de ni skyed pa gzhan med pa kho nar skyes par sems na /
analyzed: ci ste 'di snyam du skye bzhin pa skyed par byed pa'i skye ba de ni skyed pa gzhan med pa kho nar skyes par sems na /
translated: But if you think that the arising that causes the generation of that which is arising causes the generation of that which is arising without another arising,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: then NÄgÄrjuna explains:

original: ci ste skye ba med skyes na //
analyzed: ci ste skye ba med skyes na //
translated: If that which is not arisen causes the generation of that which is arising,

original: thams cad de bzhin skye bar 'gyur //ğŸ”½ci ste skye bzhin pa skyed pa'i skye ba de skyed pa gzhan med par skyes par rtog na gzhan thams cad kyang de @48a * //
analyzed: thams cad de bzhin skye bar 'gyur // ci ste skye bzhin pa skyed pa'i skye ba de skyed pa gzhan med par skyes par rtog na gzhan thams cad kyang de @48a * //
translated: then everything would arise in that way.

original: bzhin du skyed pa gzhan med par skye bar 'gyur bar brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin du skyed pa gzhan med par skye bar 'gyur bar brtag par bya'o //
translated: If you imagine that the arising that causes the generation of that which is arising causes the generation of that which is arising without another arising, then you should imagine that everything else is also generated without another arising.

original: yang gzhan yang /ğŸ”½re zhig yod dang med pa yang //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang / re zhig yod dang med pa yang //
translated: Moreover:ğŸ”½It is not tenable that that which is existent or nonexistent

original: skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: arises.

original: yod med nyid kyang ma yin te //
analyzed: yod med nyid kyang ma yin te //
translated: Nor is it both existent and nonexistent,

original: gong du bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gong du bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: As has been explained above.

original: 'di la gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig skye bar gyur na /
analyzed: 'di la gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig skye bar gyur na /

original: de yod pa'am med pa zhig skye bar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: de yod pa'am med pa zhig skye bar 'gyur grang na /

original: rigs pas yongs su brtags na /
analyzed: rigs pas yongs su brtags na /

original: yod pa ni skye bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa ni skye bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not tenable that an existent arises,

original: skye bar brtag pa don med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bar brtag pa don med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be pointless to conceive of its arising.

original: med pa yang skye bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa yang skye bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it tenable that a nonexistent arises,

original: med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is nonexistent.

original: ci ste yod med cig skye bar sems na /
analyzed: ci ste yod med cig skye bar sems na /
translated: But if you think that something both existent and nonexistent arises,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that also is not tenable.

original: kho bos gong du /ğŸ”½re zhig yod dang med pa yang //
analyzed: kho bos gong du / re zhig yod dang med pa yang //
translated: As I have already explained above:ğŸ”½First, it is not tenable

original: skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //ğŸ”½zhes bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: skye bar rigs pa ma yin no // zhes bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: That an existent or nonexistent arises.

original: yang na yod pa dang med pa dang yod med dag ji ltar skye bar rigs pa ma yin pa de ltar kho bos gong du /
analyzed: yang na yod pa dang med pa dang yod med dag ji ltar skye bar rigs pa ma yin pa de ltar kho bos gong du /
translated: Or, just as it is not tenable that an existent, nonexistent, or both existent and nonexistent arise, as I have already explained above:ğŸ”½When a phenomenon is not established

original: gang tshe chos ni yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi sgrub pa //
analyzed: gang tshe chos ni yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi sgrub pa //
translated: As existent, nonexistent, or both existent and nonexistent,

original: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya //
analyzed: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya //
translated: How could it be a cause?

original: de ltar yin na mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar yin na mi rigs so //
translated: If it were, it would be illogical.

original: zhes bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: This is the very point that is taught.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: dngos po 'ga' bzhin nyid la ni //
analyzed: dngos po 'ga' bzhin nyid la ni //
translated: With respect to an existent thing itself,

original: skye ba 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: arising is not tenable.

original: 'di la khyod kyis dngos po skye bzhin bskyed par byed do zhes gang smras pa'i dngos po skye bzhin pa gang yin pa de ni 'gag pa'i chos can yin pas 'gag bzhin pa nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: 'di la khyod kyis dngos po skye bzhin bskyed par byed do zhes gang smras pa'i dngos po skye bzhin pa gang yin pa de ni 'gag pa'i chos can yin pas 'gag bzhin pa nyid kyang yin te /
translated: In this regard, you say, â€œThe thing that is in the process of arising is generated.â€ Whatever thing is in the process of arising is a phenomenon that is ceasing, and thus it is also in the process of ceasing.

original: dngos po 'gag bzhin pa nyid de la ni skye ba 'thad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po 'gag bzhin pa nyid de la ni skye ba 'thad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: With respect to that thing that is in the process of ceasing, arising is not tenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: de la phan tshun mi mthun pa'i bya ba gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la phan tshun mi mthun pa'i bya ba gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it follows that two mutually incompatible actions would occur.

original: 'gag pa'i bya ba gang gis 'gag bzhin pa'i chos can du brtag pa dang de la yang skye ba'i bya ba yod pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'gag pa'i bya ba gang gis 'gag bzhin pa'i chos can du brtag pa dang de la yang skye ba'i bya ba yod pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The action of ceasing by which it is conceived as a phenomenon that is in the process of ceasing and the action of arising that it has would be incompatible.

original: gcig la dus gcig tu 'gag pa dang / skye ba ston pa'i bya ba phan tshun mi mthun pa gnyis yod pa de ni mi 'dod pas /
analyzed: gcig la dus gcig tu 'gag pa dang / skye ba ston pa'i bya ba phan tshun mi mthun pa gnyis yod pa de ni mi 'dod pas /
translated: Because it is unacceptable that a single thing has two mutually incompatible actionsâ€”one that demonstrates cessation and one that demonstrates arisingâ€”at the same time.

original: de'i phyir 'gag bzhin pa'i chos can nyid la skye ba 'thad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gag bzhin pa'i chos can nyid la skye ba 'thad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore it is not tenable that arising occurs in a phenomenon that is in the process of cessation.

original: snang ba dang mun pa bzhin no //
analyzed: snang ba dang mun pa bzhin no //
translated: This is just like light and darkness.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: 'o na de gang 'gag bzhin pa'i chos can ma yin pa'i dngos po de skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na de gang 'gag bzhin pa'i chos can ma yin pa'i dngos po de skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Well then, that thing that is not in the process of cessation arises.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:

original: gang zhig 'gag bzhin ma yin pa //
analyzed: gang zhig 'gag bzhin ma yin pa //
translated: That which is not in the process of cessation

original: de ni dngos por mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ni dngos por mi 'thad do //
translated: Is not tenable as a thing.

original: gang zhig 'gag @48b bzhin ma yin pa de ni 'ga' yang dngos por mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gang zhig 'gag @48b bzhin ma yin pa de ni 'ga' yang dngos por mi 'thad do //
translated: That which is not in the process of cessation is not tenable as a thing in any way.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: da ni dngos po khas blangs kyang gnas pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: da ni dngos po khas blangs kyang gnas pa mi 'thad de /
translated: even if you accept that things exist, it is not tenable that they endure.

original: ji ltar zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na bshad pa /
translated: How is that? It is explained:

original: dngos po gnas pa mi gnas te //ğŸ”½dngos po mi gnas gnas pa min //
analyzed: dngos po gnas pa mi gnas te // dngos po mi gnas gnas pa min //
translated: A thing that endures does not endure.ğŸ”½A thing that does not endure does not endure.

original: gnas bzhin pa yang mi gnas te //
analyzed: gnas bzhin pa yang mi gnas te //
translated: That which is in the process of enduring does not endure.

original: ma skyes gang zhig gnas par byed //
analyzed: ma skyes gang zhig gnas par byed //
translated: What thing that has not arisen endures?

original: re zhig dngos po gnas pa ni gnas par mi byed de gnas pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig dngos po gnas pa ni gnas par mi byed de gnas pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: First, endurance does not cause endurance of a thing that endures because endurance exists.

original: mi gnas pa yang gnas par mi byed de gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gnas pa yang gnas par mi byed de gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor does it cause endurance of a thing that does not endure because endurance does not exist.

analyzed: de gnyis las gzhan pa gnas bzhin pa zhes bya ba gsum pa yang gnas par mi byed de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor does it cause endurance of a third alternative, called â€œthat which is in the process of enduring,â€ because it does not exist.

original: de ltar rnam pa thams cad du yongs su brtags na /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa thams cad du yongs su brtags na /
translated: Thus, when one examines in every way,

original: ma skyes pa gang zhig da gnas par byed /
analyzed: ma skyes pa gang zhig da gnas par byed /
translated: what unarisen thing does endurance cause to endure?

original: yang gzhan yang /ğŸ”½dngos po 'gag bzhin nyid la ni //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang / dngos po 'gag bzhin nyid la ni //
translated: Moreover:ğŸ”½Endurance of a thing that is in the process of ceasing

original: gnas pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Is untenable.

original: de la ni gnas pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de la ni gnas pa mi 'thad de /
translated: Endurance is untenable in that thing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de la gnas skabs phan tshun mi mthun pa gnyis su thal par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la gnas skabs phan tshun mi mthun pa gnyis su thal par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it follows that it would have two mutually incompatible states.

original: gnas skabs gang gi 'gag bzhin pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba dang / de la yang gnas pa'i gnas skabs su brtag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs gang gi 'gag bzhin pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba dang / de la yang gnas pa'i gnas skabs su brtag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The state in which it is called â€œthat which is in the process of ceasingâ€ and the state in which it is called â€œthat which is enduringâ€ are mutually incompatible.

original: gcig la dus gcig tu 'gag bzhin pa dang / gnas pa ston par byed pa'i gnas skabs phan tshun mi mthun pa gnyis yod pa de ni mi 'dod pas /
analyzed: gcig la dus gcig tu 'gag bzhin pa dang / gnas pa ston par byed pa'i gnas skabs phan tshun mi mthun pa gnyis yod pa de ni mi 'dod pas /
translated: Because it is unacceptable that a single thing has two mutually incompatible states that simultaneously ariseâ€”one that demonstrates cessation and one that demonstrates endurance.

original: de'i phyir 'gag bzhin pa'i chos can nyid gnas par byed do zhes bya ba de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gag bzhin pa'i chos can nyid gnas par byed do zhes bya ba de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is illogical to say, â€œThe very phenomenon that is in the process of cessation endures.â€

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: 'o na dngos po gang 'gag bzhin pa'i chos can ma yin pa de gnas par byed do //
analyzed: 'o na dngos po gang 'gag bzhin pa'i chos can ma yin pa de gnas par byed do //
translated: Then a phenomenon that is not in the process of cessation endures.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response, NÄgÄrjuna explains:

original: gang zhig 'gag bzhin ma yin pa //
analyzed: gang zhig 'gag bzhin ma yin pa //
translated: That which is not in the process of cessation

original: de ni dngos por mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ni dngos por mi 'thad do //
translated: Is untenable as a thing.

original: gang zhig 'gag bzhin ma yin pa de ni 'ga' yang dngos po nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gang zhig 'gag bzhin ma yin pa de ni 'ga' yang dngos po nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: That which is not in the process of cessation is untenable as a thing in any way.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: dngos po thams cad dus kun tu //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad dus kun tu //
translated: All things at all times

original: rga dang 'chi ba'i chos yin na //
analyzed: rga dang 'chi ba'i chos yin na //
translated: Are subject to aging and death.ğŸ”½What thing that is not

original: gang dag rga dang 'chi med par //ğŸ”½gnas pa'i dngos po gang zhig yin //
analyzed: gang dag rga dang 'chi med par //ğŸ”½gnas pa'i dngos po gang zhig yin //
translated: Free from aging and death endures?

original: dngos po thams cad dus kun tu rga ba dang 'chi ba'i chos yin na gang dag rga ba dang / 'chi ba med par gnas pa'i dngos po de dag gang zhig yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad dus kun tu rga ba dang 'chi ba'i chos yin na gang dag rga ba dang / 'chi ba med par gnas pa'i dngos po de dag gang zhig yin par 'gyur /
translated: If all things are by nature subject to aging and death at all times, then what are those things that endure without aging and death?

original: yang gzhan yang /ğŸ”½gnas pa gnas pa gzhan dang ni //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang / gnas pa gnas pa gzhan dang ni //
translated: Moreover:ğŸ”½It is illogical that endurance endures

original: de nyid kyis kyang gnas mi rigs //ğŸ”½ji ltar skye ba rang dang ni //
analyzed: de nyid kyis kyang gnas mi rigs // ji ltar skye ba rang dang ni //
